publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2653 Jackie Baillie: Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drugâ€”That the Parliament warmly welcomes the development of the new breast cancer drug, Femara (letrozole), which is a major weapon in the fight against the disease by cutting the risk of breast cancer recurring by 42% and lowering the risk of cancer spreading to other parts of the body by 39%; notes that this throws a lifeline to post-menopausal women, the majority of breast cancer patients; further notes that the drug prevents breast cancer recurrence and is a breakthrough in the battle against the most common form of cancer among Scottish women, as the only prior options were surgery and a maximum of five years tamoxifen therapy with no other preventative measures available after these, and acknowledges that the drug lowers the number of women needing expensive treatment for recurring cancers while providing new hope for a positive and healthy future.
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Margaret Smith*, Michael McMahon*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Eleanor Scott*, John Scott*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Donald Gorrie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Mary Scanlon*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Cathy Peattie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Trish Godman*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Shiona Baird*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-2653 Breakthrough Breast Cancer Drug (lodged on 24 March 2005) Helen Eadie* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
